A Charming Exploration of "What If...?" (Spoiler-Free)
Look Both Ways takes a simple yet delightful premise and spins it into a heartwarming journey of self-discovery. Lili Reinhart shines as Natalie, a college grad facing a life-altering choice. The film then cleverly splits into two paths, letting us see how her life unfolds depending on that single decision. Here's what makes Look Both Ways a pleasant watch:
•	Relatable Heroine: Lili Reinhart brings a genuine charm to Natalie, making her struggles and triumphs feel real.
•	Dual-Narrative Twist: The concept of exploring two alternate realities is engaging, allowing us to ponder the possibilities within our own lives.
•	Uplifting Message: Look Both Ways ultimately celebrates the journey, emphasizing how happiness can be found regardless of the path we choose.
However, Look Both Ways might not be for everyone due to these reasons:
•	Lighter on Plot: The focus is more on character growth and emotional exploration than intricate storylines.
•	Familiar Territory: The "sliding doors" concept has been explored before, so the narrative might feel predictable for some.
•	Limited Depth: While the film is heartwarming, it doesn't delve too deeply into complex emotional territories.
Look Both Ways is a charming and heartwarming film, perfect for a feel-good night in. It might not be a groundbreaking cinematic experience, but it offers a relatable protagonist, a clever narrative twist, and a positive message. For a light and optimistic exploration of life's choices, Look Both Ways earns a delightful 3 out of 5 stars.

"Look Both Ways" is an okay movie with a great message. I liked the concept of this movie and think it is a clever idea. I did feel that the story could have been more interesting and engaging, but I still liked what it was trying to say. The journey is sweet and good-natured enough for a casual one-time watch. It's the type of movie that has that made for TV quality but in a way that makes sense for something to watch on Netflix. Sometimes the dialogue and situations feel a bit far-fetched, but its heart is pure and for that, I enjoyed watching the movie. Overall it is a cute movie with a strong message that makes up for any storytelling flaws.
